Articles.Content:
April 27th has historically not proved to be a very interesting day. The only space related thing I could find was: 2002 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ The last successful telemetry from the NASA space probe Pioneer 10.

Which is kinda sad actually. Can someone edit this page to include the KSP release? http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/April_27 Bonus points if you can sneak Hype in there.

April 27th has historically not proved to be a very interesting day. The only space related thing I could find was: 2002 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ The last successful telemetry from the NASA space probe Pioneer 10.

Which is kinda sad actually. Can someone edit this page to include the KSP release? http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/April_27 Bonus points if you can sneak Hype in there.

Gerard K. O'neill died, Beethoven composed Fur Elise, and the Samuel Morse, guy who invented morse code was born. Not historically insignificant.
Unlucky day then...

Gerard K. O'neill died, Beethoven composed Fur Elise, and the Samuel Morse, guy who invented morse code was born. Not historically insignificant.

Ok Gerard O'neill is pretty sweet, unfortunately I didn't know who that was. I was really looking for some Hype inspiration and found none. If only it was the 26th! http://news.bbc.co.uk/onthisday/hi/dates/stories/april/26/newsid_2950000/2950011.stm

Six missions before they got it right... Also why is this not a contract in KSP? Launch a rocket that crashes into the moon!!! Boom! Mad Hype if it was being released Sunday... They should move it up a day with this in mind...
well SpaceX will launch a new rocket on April 27th so that's something

well SpaceX will launch a new rocket on April 27th so that's something

Actually this is on my calendar and plan on having it on in the background as I play 1.0 (assuming it releases before then). Raise your hand if you can point out Turkmenistan on a map without names.
Maybe SpaceX has a big KSP Logo on the side of the rocket Would be... taking deep breath... soooo cool. And a well deserved reward for the developers.

I don't know...

1961 NASA launches Explorer 11 into Earth orbit to study gamma rays

1972 Apollo 16 returns to Earth

well SpaceX will launch a new rocket on April 27th so that's something

This makes my heart sing. Cannot. Wait. For. 1.0.
There is a big multiplayer event coming up, it's the KMC 1.0 Hype Party! (On DMP). There will be a good amount of players on.

They read my mind on the new lab changes. The very first release with the lab I thought it seemed incredibly strange, the space station has been doing science experiments non stop since they built it.

Super hype baby! I can't wait till the 27th.

Just imagine if real life worked like that.

"Oh crap, the universe is updating next week! We gotta get the astronauts home from the space station before reentry starts causing fiery explosions!"
